section.title: New Features
section.p: Anyone using 0.9.2 will be able to use the forthcoming 1.0 without any changes to config files or anything, so it's safe to get started with that till 1.0 is cut.

Noteable things new in 1.0 include:
Webadmin (Web Administration Console)
EJB 2.0 Local interface support
New per-webapp embeddability
The openejb-jar.xml now optional

section.title: Webadmin
section.p: The Webadmin is very innovative in that it lets you plug-in your own admin beans. Here is a project that already takes advantage of the new feature.
Here are some more WebAdmin details

section.title: Per-webapp Tomcat support
section.p: OpenEJB 1.0 has the ability to load OpenEJB into webapps as an alternative to loading it into Tomcat as a whole. This means each webapp can have it's very own EJB container AND the ejbs can actually *see* the classes in the WEB-INF/lib and WEB-INF/classes directories.
This is a new feature that is not very well tested or documented. Here are some more details: http://www.mail-archive.com/dev@openejb.org/msg00182.html

section.title: Local interface support
section.p: OpenEJB 2.0 code it to become EJB 2.1 compliant. Doesn't yet support embedding in Tomcat, or the openejb.conf file structure. When we get further along we will add those features back in--it's a fair amount of work. There won't be any official 2.0 releases until we get that stuff back in.
